Description: Calcite cylinder jar: with concave sides and a rounded rim, below which there is a band of cord decoration. Interior well hollowed. The base is unusual in that it is concave instead of flat. Restored from fragments.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: G. Brunton, 'British Museum expedition to Middle Egypt, 1929-1931 Matmar' (London, 1948), 25 and pl. XXIII, 13.
